definition.description: Represents a user's inbox. Path-based ownership enforced, allowing only the user with matching userId to access the inbox. Includes denormalized 'userId' for authorization.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the inbox.

definition.description: Represents a message within a user's inbox.  Path-based ownership is inherited from the parent inbox, ensuring only the owner can access the messages within. Includes denormalized 'userId' from inbox for authorization.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the inbox.

params.name: inboxId
params.description: The ID of the inbox the message belongs to.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure and scalable solution for managing inboxes and messages, adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence and Structural Segregation.  The structure enforces path-based ownership for inboxes (`/users/{userId}/inboxes/{inboxId}`) ensuring that only the owner (the user with the matching `userId`) can access the inbox and its messages. Messages are stored as subcollections within inboxes (`/users/{userId}/inboxes/{inboxId}/messages/{messageId}`), also reflecting ownership and simplifying security rules. Each message contains sender and recipient IDs, which can be used for quick filtering and display in the UI. This approach avoids `get()` calls and facilitates secure list operations (QAPs) because access control is determined by the path structure and doesn't rely on data within parent documents.
